page.title: 20Farming in Upper Strensham
page.content: There are 3 mixed arabel farms. Strensham farm also produces market garden crops. Cattle are raised at Home Farm and there are also about 50 at Bredonfields, but none have dairy herds. 50 acres of sugar beet and 30 arcres of fodder peas are grown at Bredonfields. About 400 sheep are bought in the Autumn kept through the Winter and sold in early Summer.For the most part the soil is light, with terraces down to the river Avon of glacial sand underlined with blue haig clay of the Evesham series. The M5 and the M50 were built through fields on each farm and the junction of two is at Bredonfields, so this farm was cut into three. Only two farm workers have houses in the village. Bed and breakfast accommodation is offered at Strensham farm. Survey carried out by Strensham WI.
